passage: Human-made (synthetic) fibers used in clothes and many other consumer products are more durable than most natural plant ______ blank the manufacture of synthetic fibers requires toxic chemical solvents that can pollute air and water.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is the coordination of main clauses within a sentence. This choice correctly uses a comma and the coordinating conjunction "but" to join the first main clause ("Human-made...fibers") and the second main clause ("the manufacture...water").
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect because it results in a comma splice. Without a conjunction following it, a comma can't be used in this way to join two main clauses.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because when coordinating two longer main clauses such as these, it's conventional to use a comma before the coordinating conjunction.
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because it results in a run-on sentence. The two main clauses are fused without punctuation and/or a conjunction.
